STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
December 12, 2023
Timothy J Smith
Charlevoix County Probate & Family Court
301 State ST,
Charlevoix, MI, 49720-1396
RE: License#: CA150201032
Dear Mr. Smith:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on December 5, 2023. The renewal inspection has determined substantial compliance
with applicable licensing statutes and rules. Your license is renewed, and you will be
receiving the license in the mail. It is valid only at your present address and is
nontransferable. If you move, please notify us at least 30 days in advance.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Jessica VandenHeuvel, Area Manager, at 616-204-6992.
Sincerely,
Douglas Turrill, Licensing Consultant
enclosure
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
• Technical assistance was not offered at this time.
V. CONSULTATION
• Consultation was not requested or offered at this time.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during
this period under review.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrators Annual Assessment was submitted and reviewed. The
assessment discussed the agency's efforts to maintain knowledge of licensing
rules and PA 116. The assessment reported that there were no barriers to
maintaining compliance.
Financial Overview

The agency submitted a budget for the current year. The program budget is under
an umbrella including other Court operated programs. The agency program did not
have any income generated from the previous year and expenditures were
generated from the Courts school program. The agency has not had any foster
children in placement in over two years.
Staff Interviews
The Chief Administrator reported that recruitment of foster homes is difficult, and it
is hoped that the court would be able to license a home in the coming year.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The courts programing is located in a local school building. The facility is well
maintained and organized. CHRI documentation was stored securely.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
The agency is non-contracted.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes. It is recommended that the agency be issued a renewal of their
regular license.
December 7, 2023
_____________________________________
Douglas Turrill Date
Licensing Consultant
